snippet: Samsung and Apple lawyers butted heads over the more than $1 billion in damages that a federal jury awarded Apple in August, but the judge in the case issued no new rulings in the case.
abstract: Samsung and Apple lawyers butted heads over the more than $1 billion in damages that a federal jury awarded Apple in August, but the judge in the case issued no new rulings in the case.

headline.main: Apple and Samsung Tangle on Damages and Juror

snippet: Julius Genachowski, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, sent a letter to the Federal Aviation Administration urging the agency to allow more electronics on airplanes.

Stocks closed higher as investors awaited the key monthly jobs report on Friday.

snippet: Deutsche Telekom, the parent company of T-Mobile USA, said that it had entered a partnership with Apple to sell its products for use on its network in 2013. T-Mobile USA is the last major carrier in the United States that does not offer Apple prod...
abstract: Deutsche Telekom, the parent company of T-Mobile USA, said that it had entered a partnership with Apple to sell its products for use on its network in 2013. T-Mobile USA is the last major carrier in the United States that does not offer Apple products.

headline.main: T-Mobile Will Sell Apple Devices in 2013

snippet: In an interview with NBC, the chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, said the television was “an area of intense interest” for the company.
abstract: In an interview with NBC, the chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, said the television was “an area of intense interest” for the company.

headline.main: Does Apple's Tim Cook Want an Apple Television?

snippet: Some analysts are hopeful that the move by a big, innovative company like Apple could inspire a broader renaissance in American manufacturing, but a number of experts remain skeptical.

headline.main: In Shift of Jobs, Apple Will Make Some Macs in U.S.
headline.print_headline: In Shift of Jobs, Apple Will Make Some Macs in U.S.

byline.original: By CATHERINE RAMPELL and NICK WINGFIELD

snippet: For the first time in years, Apple will manufacture computers in the United States, the chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, said in interviews with NBC and Bloomberg Businessweek. As an icon of American technology success and innovation, Ap...
abstract: For the first time in years, Apple will manufacture computers in the United States, the chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, said in interviews with NBC and Bloomberg Businessweek. As an icon of American technology success and innovation, Apple has been criticized in recent years for outsourcing jobs abroad.

headline.main: Daily Report: Apple to Bring Some Manufacturing to U.S.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Bookmarks on the Home Screen

snippet: Having created the most popular Youtube video of all time, Park Jae-sang, better known as Psy, has gotten richer with each click, but mostly from the United States, rather than Asia.

headline.main: 'Gangnam Style' Riches Grow by Clicks and Bounds, but Mostly Overseas
